content.description: 5.8 climbing that is separated by a crux off of two somewhat thin crimps through a slight bulge (this can be dynoed through though if you wish for a more fun variation)
content.location: The left side of the cliff, maybe four minutes down the trail.

content.description: Fingery route down low with a triangular roof (that one can cop a nice sit down rest on) halfway up.  Difficulties ease once you surmount the roof.
content.location: 30 feet to the left of Geppetto, around the corner

content.description: Start as C-Crack, the at the traverse rip up the overhanging hand crack.
content.protection: Small to Medium cams and nuts
content.location: just as C-crack, but to come down you must downclimb the dead tree to the right to get to the lower anchors. Yikes!

content.description: Go up the easy crack system until you hit a roof.  Either continue up the roof for the direct variation, or as I recomend, head right on the horizontal, near footless, hand crack traverse.  Finish on the antkiller belay ledge.
content.protection: small to medium cams and nuts.
content.location: Just around the bulge to the left of Ant Killer.

content.description: P1  Chimney up to a slab.   P2 Airy and fun travers to a perch.  Continue to traverse left around the arete.
content.protection: Trad:  Small to mid-sized cams and some stoppers

content.description: Fantastic 5.9 Dihedral Crack.  P2 not as classic.
content.protection: Trad: Stoppers will do you fine and a few small to medium cams.

content.description: From Vertical Heartland, "The Woodland Ledge is topped by an overhang and is roughly 100 yards long."
